original_definition: 'central counter party' means the entity or entities with the task of entering into contracts with market participants, by novation of the contracts resulting from the matching process, and of organising the transfer of net positions resulting from capacity allocation with other central counter parties or shipping agents;
generated_definition: 'central counter party' means a third-party entity that acts as a counterparty to multiple market participants, ensuring anonymity and maintaining the integrity of financial transactions.
